target_name: By 2030, end hunger and ensure access by all people, in particular the poor and people in vulnerable situations, including infants, to safe, nutritious and sufficient food all year round
computation_definitions:
National data (Type1)
This is the national produced statistics in the ROK that best corresponds to the definition of UN SDGs indicators.
Download the national metadata file for more information.
indicator_name: Prevalence of moderate or severe food insecurity in the population, based on the Food Insecurity Experience Scale (FIES)
data_name: Percent of households without food security
statistics_name: Korea National Health and Nutrition Examination Survey
indicator_definition:
The percent of households without food security measures the Percent of respondents, who are the primary buyers of food for their household, answering at 1) and 2) when asked about their family food life in the last 12 months.
1) my family could have food in enough quantities and varieties
2) my family could have food in enough quantities but lacked variety
computation_calculations: Interviews with household members aged 1 and over nationwide
global_indicator_name: Prevalence of moderate or severe food insecurity in the population, based on the Food Insecurity Experience Scale (FIES)
graph_title: Percent of households without food security
data_keywords: 기아, 식량, FIES, food insecurity, UNSD, hunger, zero hunger
source_organisation_1: Division of Health and Nutrition Survey and Analysis, Bureau of Chronic Disease Prevention and Control, Korea Disease Control and Prevention Agency
